00037         "*******************************************************************************\n\r"
00038         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00039         "CAN bypass demo \n\r"
00040         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00041         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00042         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00043         "Use two CAN peripherals: CAN1 and CAN2 to communicate\n\r"
00044         "This example used to test Bypass mode\n\r"

00048 CAN_MSG_Type TXMsg, RXMsg; // messages for test Bypass mode
00049 uint32_t CANRxCount, CANTxCount = 0;

00058 
00059 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00060 /*********************************************************************/
00065 void CAN_IRQHandler()
00066 {
00067         uint8_t IntStatus;
00068         uint32_t data1;
00069         /* get interrupt status
00070          * Note that: Interrupt register CANICR will be reset after read.
00071          * So function "CAN_IntGetStatus" should be call only one time
00072          */
00073         IntStatus = CAN_IntGetStatus(LPC_CAN2);
00074         //check receive interrupt
00075         if((IntStatus>>0)&0x01)
00076         {
00077                 CAN_ReceiveMsg(LPC_CAN2,&RXMsg);
00078                 PrintMessage(&RXMsg);
00079                 CANRxCount++; //count success received message
00080                 //increase data for next TX Message
00081                 TXMsg.id ++;
00082                 data1 = (TXMsg.dataA[0])|(((TXMsg.dataA[1]))<<8)|((TXMsg.dataA[2])<<16)|((TXMsg.dataA[3])<<24);
00083                 if(data1 == 0xFFFFFFFF) data1 = 0;
00084                 else data1++;
00085                 *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataA[0])= *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataB[0])= data1 & 0x000000FF;
00086                 *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataA[1])= *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataB[1])=(data1 & 0x0000FF00)>>8;;
00087                 *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataA[2])= *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataB[2])=(data1 & 0x00FF0000)>>16;
00088                 *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataA[3])= *((uint8_t *) &TXMsg.dataB[3])=(data1 & 0xFF000000)>>24;
00089 
00090                 CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &TXMsg);
00091         }
00092 }
00093 
00094 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS----------------------------*/
00095 /*********************************************************************/
00100 void PrintMessage(CAN_MSG_Type* CAN_Msg)
00101 {
00102         uint32_t data;
00103         _DBG("Message ID:     ");
00104         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->id);_DBG_("");
00105         _DBG("Message length: ");
00106         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->len);_DBG_(" BYTES");
00107         _DBG("Message type:   ");
00108         if(CAN_Msg->type==DATA_FRAME)
00109         {
00110                 _DBG_("DATA FRAME ");
00111         }
00112         else
00113                 _DBG_("REMOTE FRAME ");
00114         _DBG("Message format: ");
00115         if(CAN_Msg->format==STD_ID_FORMAT)
00116         {
00117                 _DBG_("STANDARD ID FRAME FORMAT");
00118         }
00119         else
00120                 _DBG_("EXTENDED ID FRAME FORMAT");
00121         _DBG("Message dataA:  ");
00122         data = (CAN_Msg->dataA[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataA[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[3]<<24);
00123         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00124         data = (CAN_Msg->dataB[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataB[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[3]<<24);
00125         _DBG("Message dataB:  ");
00126         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00127         _DBG_("");
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*********************************************************************/
00135 void CAN_InitMessage(void) {
00136         TXMsg.format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00137         TXMsg.id = 0x00001234;
00138         TXMsg.len = 8;
00139         TXMsg.type = DATA_FRAME;
00140         TXMsg.dataA[0] = TXMsg.dataA[1] = TXMsg.dataA[2] = TXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00141         TXMsg.dataB[0] = TXMsg.dataB[1] = TXMsg.dataB[2] = TXMsg.dataB[3] = 0x00000000;
00142 
00143         RXMsg.format = 0x00;
00144         RXMsg.id = 0x00;
00145         RXMsg.len = 0x00;
00146         RXMsg.type = 0x00;
00147         RXMsg.dataA[0] = RXMsg.dataA[1] = RXMsg.dataA[2] = RXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00148         RXMsg.dataB[0] = RXMsg.dataB[1] = RXMsg.dataB[2] = RXMsg.dataB[3] = 0x00000000;
00149 }
00150 
00151 /*********************************************************************/
00156 void print_menu()
00157 {
00158         _DBG_(menu);
00159 }

00161 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00162 /*********************************************************************/
00167 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00168         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00169 
00170         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00171          * – 115200bps
00172          * – 8 data bit
00173          * – No parity
00174          * – 1 stop bit
00175          * – No flow control
00176          */
00177         debug_frmwrk_init();
00178         print_menu();
00179 
00180         /* Pin configuration
00181          * CAN1: select P0.0 as RD1. P0.1 as TD1
00182          * CAN2: select P2.7 as RD2, P2.8 as RD2
00183          */
00184         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00185         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00186         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00187         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00188         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00189         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00190         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00191         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00192 
00193         PinCfg.Pinnum = 7;
00194         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00195         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00196         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00197         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00198 
00199         //Initialize CAN1 & CAN2
00200         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN1, 125000);
00201         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN2, 125000);
00202 
00203         //Enable Interrupt
00204         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN2, CANINT_RIE, ENABLE);
00205 
00206         //Enable CAN Interrupt
00207         NVIC_EnableIRQ(CAN_IRQn);
00208 
00209         _DBG_("CAN test Bypass Mode function...");
00210         _DBG_("Press '1' to initialize CAN message...");_DBG_("");
00211         while(_DG !='1');
00212         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF,CAN_AccBP);
00213         CAN_InitMessage();
00214         PrintMessage(&TXMsg);
00215         _DBG_("Message ID and data will be increased continuously...");
00216 
00217         _DBG_("Press '2' to start CAN operation...");
00218         while(_DG !='2');
00219 
00223         CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &TXMsg);
00224 
00225         while (1);
00226 }
00227 
00228 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00229  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00230  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00231  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00232  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00233 int main(void) {
00234         return c_entry();
00235 }
